stories.title: Consolidate save handlers in RecordingSettings.tsx
stories.description: Merged handleSaveSettings and handleSaveRecordingMode into single handler. Removed savingSettings/savingMode split, back to single saving state. Handler now saves ALL fields including join_all_meetings.
acceptance: Single handleSaveSettings saves all fields including join_all_meetings
Both Save Settings and Save Recording Mode buttons use same handler
Toggling External Meetings Only and saving actually persists

stories.title: Verify NotetakerSettingsTab save buttons match pattern
stories.description: Verified NotetakerSettingsTab already has unified handleSaveSettings with join_all_meetings included. Both Save Settings (line 806) and Save Recording Mode (line 941) buttons call same handler. No changes needed.
acceptance: NotetakerSettingsTab has unified save that includes join_all_meetings
No orphaned save buttons calling wrong handlers
Both pages behave identically when saving

stories.title: Verify recordingService merge behavior
stories.description: Confirmed recordingService.updateRecordingSettings (line 709) uses spread merge: `const updated = { ...current, ...settings }`. Partial updates don't wipe other fields. No changes needed.
acceptance: Partial update does not reset unmentioned fields
Merge pattern confirmed in service layer

stories.title: Unified save buttons use same handler
stories.description: Both 'Save Settings' and 'Save Recording Mode' buttons now call the same handleSaveSettings handler with single saving spinner state. Each saves ALL settings fields. Matches NotetakerSettingsTab pattern.
acceptance: RecordingSettings has one save handler for both buttons
Each card's save button saves ALL fields
